title: Orthogonal and Orthonormal Sets
contentHtml: In linear algebra, we often encounter sets of vectors that are either orthogonal or orthonormal.

problem.statementHtml: Given two vectors, \mathbf{a} and \mathbf{b}, determine if they are orthogonal.
problem.solutionHtml:
To check for orthogonality, we can calculate the dot product:

\(\mathbf{a}^T \mathbf{b} = 0\)

If this is true, then \mathbf{a} and \mathbf{b} are orthogonal.
